annotation.spannedText: right middle and lower lobe opacity

classMention.mentionClass: right middle and lower lobe opacity

annotation.spannedText: Transfer from [**Hospital Unit Name 1**] for XRT on [**Hospital Ward Name **] with respiratory failure [**1-7**] post-obstructive PNA 24 Hour Events: In summary, this is a 72 y/o male with COPD, CAD s/p angioplasty in [**2180**], afib and small cell lung CA who started [**First Name9 (NamePattern2) 2007**] [**8-19**] with carboplatin/VP-16 in [**State 395**]. He initially presented to SMMC on [**8-23**] with hypotension after accidental overdose on diltiazem. There, a CXR showed R lung white out and was transferred to [**Hospital1 19**] for bronch given concern for mass compression of the bronchus. Chest CT at [**Hospital1 19**] showed large centrally obstructing mass with right apical pneumothorax, right middle and lower lobe opacity, pigtail was placed. Patient was then bronched on [**8-24**] with purulent drainage, stent was placed and started on Vanco/Zosyn for presumed post-obstructive pneumonia. Patient continued to be intubated after the bronch and developed hypotension requiring pressors. Patient also noted to be neutropenic thought likely [**1-7**] [**Month/Day (2) 2007**] and sepsis and patient with afib with RVR on a dilt gtt. This morning he was mapped for XRT and received his first dose of radiation.

annotation.spannedText: 72 year old male with COPD, CAD initially presented with hypotension [**1-7**] diltiazem overdose, noted to have post-obstructive PNA requiring bronch and stent placement, PNX requiring chest tube placement, transferred from SICU for XRT with continued hypoxic respiratory failure and hypotension requiring pressors. # Hypoxic Respiratory Failure: Patient intubated for his procedure and not able to be weaned. Likely multifactorial, from post-obstructive PNA, PNX, and underlying lung disease (COPD). -continue nebs but d/c fluticasone -Wean Vent as tolerated -BNP, consider ECHO #Hypotension: [**Last Name (un) **] stim normal. Likely sepsis, though ?diltiazem for afib with RVR. -repeat blood cultures -U/A with urine culture -f/u sputum cultures -change propofol to fent/midaz #Pneumothorax: -continue chest tube #Pancytopenia: Likely [**1-7**] [**Month/Day (2) 2007**] and sepsis. Patient has been normo-temperature. -transfuse PLTs for bleeding or for <10 -neutropenic precautions -continue neupogen #Transaminitis: LFTs trending down, likely due to shock on top of known liver mets. -RUQ U/S #Afib: goal HR <100, on sotalol [**Hospital1 7**], holding anticoagulation given thrombocytopenia #Small Cell Lung CA: Followed by onc, would be due for next round of [**Hospital1 2007**] next week, but pending return of his counts. Had head CT with and without and no mets. Undergoing XRT. #?sinusitis seen on CT head. DELIRIUM / CONFUSION HYPOTENSION (NOT SHOCK) CANCER (MALIGNANT NEOPLASM), LUNG HYPERKALEMIA (HIGH POTASSIUM, HYPERPOTASSEMIA) ATRIAL FIBRILLATION (AFIB) PLEURAL EFFUSION, ACUTE ICU Care Nutrition: Glycemic Control: Lines: Multi Lumen - [**2193-8-24**] 01:30 PM Arterial Line - [**2193-8-24**] 01:30 PM Prophylaxis: DVT: Stress ulcer: VAP: Comments: Communication: Comments: Code status: Full code Disposition:
